meanings.definition: A foreboding or warning of future events.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds in the sky gave me bad bodings about the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of unease, as if the bodings of danger were closing in on her.
meanings.sent3: The cat's strange behavior was a boding of an imminent mouse invasion.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest was a boding of an approaching predator.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind carried with it the bodings of an impending disaster.

meanings.definition: An omen or sign of something to come.
meanings.sent1: Seeing a black cat cross your path is considered a boding of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was a clear boding of the approaching winter.
meanings.sent3: Finding a four-leaf clover is usually seen as a boding of good fortune.
meanings.sent4: The flickering streetlight was a boding of the power outage that followed.
meanings.sent5: The distant sound of thunder served as a boding of the coming storm.
